intro: Cyrtochilum trilamellatum, commonly known as the three-lobed orchid, is a species of orchid native to the Andes of South America. It is characterized by its compact, sympodial growth habit and its distinctive flowers with three prominent lobes. The plant typically grows in high-altitude cloud forests, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are linear and covered in a dense layer of fine, white pubescence. Cyrtochilum trilamellatum is prized by orchid enthusiasts for its unique floral structure and vibrant, often purple or pink-colored blooms.
